page.title: 11Infant Education in Soham
page.content: There has been an Infant School for over a hundred years.Originally it was situated in Clay Street.The new school was opened in 1971, and on the day of opening was open from 7.pm _ 9.pm to enable all the village to look around. There are 8 classes in the main school and two nursery classes in a mobile building.The children have one year of half days in the nursery and two or three years full time education. There are 266 infants and 102 in the nursery. Next term there will be a mobile classroom as the numbers of children are going up and up. There is a kitchen attached to the school which cooks for Wicken school, the two Soham junior schools and the meals on wheels service.
